page.title: 04Employment
page.content: The main employers of the area are the {textile and footwear}industries. The{ {textile}industry does not employ as many people as previously as many mills have closed down. About{12%}of the working population are now unemployed.{Carrs Industrial Estate}is an Enterprise Zone, opened in 1983. Grants have been given by the{E.E.C.} to encourage people to open factories there. The local by-pass which joins the M66 has resulted in better communications to the area. Goods can be brought in and taken out quickly. Locally{12%}are unemployed,{35%}work in manufacturing industries and{47%}in service areas.{6%}are house-wives. The average working week is{48 hours}for men and{26 hours}for women.
